choices: Connor notices something's different right away.
Connor goes about his morning, and starts growing at school.
Connor gets kidnapped by mysterious men on the way to school.
Connor skips school and tries to have fun, but his growth gets in the way.
Something Else
1.content:
*BEEP BEEP BEEP*

Connor rolled over and smacked the alarm clock, trying to hit the snooze button. Missing by several inches, he instead knocked the clock to the floor, where it continued its loud beeping. Not wanting to actually get up out of bed, Connor grabbed a pillow and buried his head in it, trying to drown out the noise. It was no use. His mom had bought him an industrial-strength alarm, knowing that he hated waking up in the mornings.

Of course, this morning should have been different.  After all, it was Connor's 13th birthday; his first day as a teenager. Most kids look forward to that, counting down the days one by one, barely able to hold in their excitement of the magic "-teen" suffix. Almost all of his friends in school had big parties on their 13th birthday.

Not Connor. It may have had a little to do with the fact that, being the youngest in his class, he was thus the last one celebrating this milestone, and the big "1-3" didn't hold much weight among his peers.  It may have been because his parents refused to throw him a party or any real celebration.  "You're a big man, now," his dad had said, "and you'll have to do what all other men do on their birthdays: work."  Why, oh why couldn't this day have fallen on a weekend?

But the big reason that Connor wasn't celebrating this day was that he knew that it would change nothing.  He still had to go to the same crummy school and live in the same crummy house with the same crummy family in the same crummy town in the same crummy country in the same crummy planet.  Thirteen was just a meaningless number, no different from Twelve or Fourteen, really.

Of course, that's what he thought at the beginning of the day.  But at the end, well, he had an entirely new perspective.
1.title: Connor's Big Day

choices: Connor faces his family, who is horrified
Conner faces his family, who thinks he's always been this tall
Connor sneaks out the window, and tries to find help
While thinking it over, Connor experiences another growth spurt.
Other
11.content:
As he finally threw the pillow off his head and resigned to the fact that he'd have to wake up to face another day, Connor gradually came aware of a dull pain coming from his mouth.  He never quite got used to the uncomfortable feeling wearing braces gave him, even though he had them for over a year now, and this morning, his mouth was extra-sore, like his orthodontist had just tightened them.  Odd, seeing as he hadn't been to the orthodontist in over a month.

He swung his feet out of bed and onto the ground, hitting the floor with a loud THUD.  He reached down and grabbed his alarm clock, shutting it off.  He toyed with crawling back underneath the covers and trying to fall back asleep, but he was already too awake now, and besides, his mother would be up in just a few minutes to make sure he was getting ready.

As he stood up and began to make his way towards the bathroom, Connor's head started to pound, his body ached all over, and he had a hard time keeping his balance.  "This must be what it feels like to have a hangover," he thought.  But why? He had never drunk alcohol, and he had plenty of sleep last night.  Maybe it was just one of those mornings.

He reached the bathroom, flipped on the light switch, and hopped into the shower, washing the sleep from his eyes.  Though his headache and wooziness subsided, something still felt peculiar, and he couldn't quite place his finger on it.

He finished up in the bathroom, brushed his teeth, and then grabbed a hair drier.  It was then that he finally looked at himself in the mirror, and stopped.  Something was different!  It wasn't his hair; it was still a shaggy brown mess.  His eyes were as dark as ever, his nose and mouth were the same...  He looked at himself up and down, and noticed that...he was bigger!  His waist line was level with the bottom of the mirror just the night before, but now it was several inches above it!

"What the hell's going on?"  Connor said aloud.

"What's that honey?"  It was Connor's mom's voice.  She must be outside in the hallway!

Not wanting to bring this to her attention just yet, he said, "Uh, nothing important, Mom."

"All right, dear," she said, "but make sure you're down for breakfast in five minutes."  She turned and walked down the stairs, back to the kitchen.

Connor slowly opened the door, peeked outside, and made sure no one was coming.  He then darted across the hall, back to his bedroom.  He grabbed an undershirt and a pair of boxer briefs from his dresser.  Both of them felt very tight; his undershirt didn't even cover his stomach!  The clothes he was wearing the night before were still on the floor; he picked them up and put them back on.  Whereas last night they fit just fine, this morning his shirt barely reached his belt line, and he had to struggle to get his pants on.  When he finally did, they wouldn't fasten shut, so he had to get the braided belt he hated from his closet and use it for cover, as it was the only belt that fit him now.

"Okay," Connor said, "this should work."  At this point, though, he felt his muscles begin to burn. He looked down, and was shocked by what he saw.  He could actually see his legs getting longer, as the cuff of his pants rose higher above his ankle.  The belt began to stretch further, straining to stay together, and his shirt was revealing more and more skin.  Finally, Connor heard a loud RIPPPPP sound, as his shirt tore up the sides.

"Shit!"  He said, as he quickly took his clothes off so that he wouldn't ruin any more of them.  He stood there, dumbfounded, for a few minutes, only in his undershirt and boxers, which themselves were straining to keep it together.

He tried to figure out how tall he was.  He knew the top of his doorframe was seven feet off the ground, and his head was about 10 inches from that, so he had to be over six feet.  It was a gain of almost a foot, in just one night!

"Wow," Connor said, "I've heard of growth spurts, but this is ridiculous!"

Suddenly, he heard his mother's voice.  "Connor!!  This is the last time I'm calling you!  Get down here for breakfast!"

Uh oh.  Connor panicked for a moment.  He couldn't let his family see him like this, could he?
11.title: Waking Up

choices: The Three Of Them Set Off Together
Connor Tries To Resist
Other
111.content:
Well, Connor said to himself, they're going to find out sooner or later.  Taking a deep breath, he stepped out of his room, and slowly descended down the stairs.  Even his footsteps were louder than usual:  THUMP THUMP THUMP.

His mother was finishing up cooking some oatmeal on the stove.  She may have looked like a timid woman, at only 5' 2", but her small frame hid a powerful force inside her.

"Well, it's about time, Con--" his mother said as she turned towards the stairs, saw her son, and gasped, dropping the pot of oatmeal she was holding.  She brought her hand up to her mouth.  "Oh, my God!  Connor..."
"Hi, mom,"  was all that Connor could say.

His six-year-old sister, Sara, looked up from the table where she was eating her Cheerios.  "Whoa, Connor!  Cool!  You're taller than Daddy now!"

Connor's mom was in tears, and she walked towards him, throwing her arms around him.  "Oh, Connor, I can't believe it really happened!"

Connor began to hug her back, but then stopped.  "Wait, what?  You know something about this? You knew this might happen?"

His mother stepped back, looked at him sadly, and then turned away.  "Uh, no, Connor, I...I just can't believe it."

Connor looked at his mother puzzled.  Thoughts were swirling around in his head, but then he felt that...burning sensation again.  Knowing what was coming next, he closed his eyes.  "Here we go again."

He could feel his skin tingle as it stretched out and he grew taller and taller.  His bones creaked and moaned as they lengthened.  His braces began to come loose from his teeth.  Finally, after a few seconds, it stopped.

Connor opened his eyes and looked down.  His undershirt was now in tatters, and his boxer briefs were stretched almost to the limit.  He now towered above his mother by a good two feet.  He looked up and saw that his head was almost at the ceiling.

He looked into his mother's eyes and saw something he had never truly seen before: fear.  She shook her head in horror and rushed to the phone.

Connor felt sorry for his mother, but deep down, he was beginning to like what was happening to him, at least a little.  He had always been on the short side, and this..whatever it was, was more than making up for it.

He then turned towards the table and looked at Sara.  She was just staring at him, partly afraid, but partly admiring too.  He squatted down next to her; even squatting, his head was above Sara's at the table.

"Whatcha thinkin', Squirt?"  He asked her.

She looked at him for a moment.  "You're not going to do anything to hurt us, right?"

Connor chuckled, "Of course not!  What made you think that?"

"Well," Sara said, looking down at her cereal, "you're pretty big now, and kinda scary.  Almost like a monster."

Connor smiled, and ran his fingers through Sara's hair.  "Don't worry, Squirt, no matter what happens to me, I'll always be there to protect you."
Sara turned back towards Connor, then reached out and hugged his arm, and gave him a kiss on his cheek.  "My big bro."

Connor nodded.  Maybe everything would be just fine, he thought.

He turned back towards his mother, who was still on the phone, very flustered.  "Listen," she was almost yelling now, "I don't care what kind of meeting he's in, interrupt him!...Yes, I know.  Just tell him these two words:  It happened!"

Connor's grin quickly turned into a frown.  Who was she talking to, and what was she talking about?  She clearly knew something that she wasn't telling.

As she hung up the phone, he looked up at her, waiting for something anything.  She just looked at him, started to cry again, and turned back towards the kitchen, and began to wash dishes.

"What was that about?" he asked.

"Nothing, honey," was her only reply.

At this moment, the school bus honked from outside.

"Um, should I get ready for school or something?"

His mother gave a half-laugh, half-sob.  "I don't think that will be neccesary, Connor.  Sara, you go ahead and get to school, okay?"

"But," Sara stammered, "if Connor gets to stay home, I want to stay home too!"

Their mother turned around quickly, with a much more serious face.  "Sara Felicity Young, you get on that bus right now!"

Sulking, Sara slid out of her chair and grabbed her bookbag from the table.  She ran up and gave Connor a quick hug on the leg.  "I'll see you later, big bro." Sara then turned around and ran out the door, towards the bus.

After she had left, Connor turned towards his mother.  "Listen, mom, I don't know what's going on here, but whatever it is, you don't need to take it out on Sara!"

As he slowly walked closer to her, she started to back away in fear.  "Stay back!  Don't come any closer!"
Connor looked at her incredulously.  "What are you talking about?  Mom, it's me, Connor!"

Suddenly, the front door burst opened, and his dad stormed in.  An impressive figure at 6'3" and 250 pounds, his dad looked like he could have played lineman for the Chicago Bears.  In reality, though, he was an accountant.

"Son," he said, as he looked sternly up at Connor, "it"s time to go."
111.title: Connor's Mother Is Horrified

choices: Connor is able to control his growth; uses it to escape
Connor's growth is still uncontrolled; he's still trapped
Other
1111.content:
Connor looked out the back window, towards the skyscrapers of the city he had called home for these past thirteen years.  He was sitting on the floor of his parents' van; they had taken out both the back seats, as this was the only way to be able to transport him at his new size.  Right before they had left, he experienced another growth spurt, and now stood at nearly ten feet tall.  The last remnants of his underwear had finally given out, so his mom had given him a bright red bed sheet, which he wrapped around himself like a loincloth.

The van ride was uncomfortable; he had to bend down during the entire ride so he wouldn't hit his head on the ceiling, and without a seat belt, he was being thrown back and forth a little bit every time his dad took a curve.

And worse yet, Connor had no idea where they were going.  He was reluctant to come along with them at first, but he didn't know what else to do.  At this moment, at least, he still had to trust them.

The van continued to go farther out into the country; the city disappeared behind them over the horizon.  Finally, Connor couldn't take it anymore.  "Dad, what's going on?  Where are we?  What are we doing?"

His father just looked forward, silent, stoic.  His mother, still crying, was looking out the passenger side window.  "We'll be there shortly, Connor," was all she said.

Connor leaned against the back of the van, befuddled and confused.  His heart had a swirl of emotions: excitement, fear, anger, and regret.  He closed his eyes and just tried to rest for the remainder of the ride.

He woke up an hour or so later, and looked out the window.  He saw a sign that read: West Taylor Army Base.

"An army base?" Connor exclaimed.  "Dad, what the hell?"

"Don't worry, Connor," his dad replied.  "This is where you belong."

Connor's blood began to boil, and his heart was filled with anger.  His parents were turning him in to the Army, for what?  His imagination raced with possibilities: some weird experiments, being used as a weapon, or even just being exterminated.  He knew he had to escape.

As his heart was racing, he felt his muscles begin to grow tense again.  He knew what was coming.  A thought raced through his head: maybe, somehow, he could control it.  He took a deep breath, and concentrated on what he was feeling.
1111.title: Van Ride

choices: Before he can help, Connor is attacked!
Connor decides to rescue his parents
11111.content:
As his muscles burned again, he focused all his energy on stretching out, trying to grow longer.  He looked down at his body.  It was working!  His feet, legs, chest, arms: they were all growing rapidly, faster than before.

He began to press up against the ceiling, but he knew he couldn't stop now.  His only chance to escape would be to outgrow the back of the van.  He didn't let up his concentration, but instead focused harder.  Sweat began to pour from his brow, and his face was turning red.

His father looked up at the rear view mirror and saw that his son was growing.  "Connor!  Stop that right now!" he yelled.

Connor ignored his dad and placed his hands against the top frame of the car.  He had to use the force of his growth to break free.  His head started to pound again, and his vision started to blur.  This was becoming too intense, he thought.  But it was the only way.

"Do you hear me young man?" his dad boomed from the front seat.  "I order you to stop!"

"Connor, please," his mother pleaded.  "You'll kill us all!"

The frame of the car began to creek.  Connor was visibly shaking now, but he had to keep going.  He was now completely filling up the back of the van.  Finally, with his last ounce of strength, the frame burst apart, the windows shattered, and the back of the car was opened.  At the same time, the immense weight of the giant in the back of the van caused the back tires to blow out.

"Shit!"  Connor's dad screamed, as the van, which was traveling at about 60 mph, began to fishtail out of control.  Connor stood up, now at an impressive height of 25 feet, and jumped from the moving van towards the side of the road.  He landed on his hands and knees, getting cut up slightly in the process, but all-in-all fine.

As he brushed the dirt from his hands, he heard a loud CRASH sound.  He turned back and saw the wreckage of his parents van that had spun off the road and smacked into a billboard a few hundred feet away.  He saw his parents in the front seat, unconscious.  The engine had started to smoke, and he could see fire starting to form.

Connor was torn.  On one hand, he was furious at his parents for wanting to turn him in to the Army.  Didn't that mean they had abandoned him?  On the other hand, they were still his family, and the wreck was at least partly his fault, so he couldn't turn his back on them.  Could he?
11111.title: Escape!

choices: They get back to the base
They are stopped along the way
111111.content:
While he was thinking of what to do, Connor suddenly heard a loud roaring from the distance.  He looked around, trying to find where the sound was coming from.  From the direction of the army base, he noticed a lot of commotion, and there was something coming his way.  He put his hand above his eyes to try to see what it was.  It looked like...

"Oh my god!" Connor swore to himself.

From the distance was a row of advancing Hummers, at least a dozen, all speeding towards him.  He did not like the looks of this one bit.

He took one last look at the car where his parents were.  Trying to rescue them would mean almost certain capture by the advancing army.  He couldn't risk it; God knows what would happen to him in their hands.

He closed his eyes.  "Mom, Dad...I'm sorry," he whispered.  He then jumped up and started running the opposite direction from the vehicles.  He stayed near the road, trying to keep hidden, a difficult task for a twenty-five foot giant.  He moved quicker than he expected; his energy levels had increased along with his size, and he was able to run at nearly a full sprint, covering ten feet with each stride.

As he came to a hill, his breathing became slightly more intense.  He stopped for  a second and looked around.  The vehicles had gotten closer; they were traveling faster than even he could, and they would catch up with him in just a few minutes.

Suddenly, a vehicle zoomed over the hill, honking its horn loudly.  It screeched to a halt, turning to avoid hitting Connor.  It looked like nothing he had ever seen before.  It was bigger than a tractor trailer, but was almost triangular in shape, with a large cargo space in the back.  It was armored like a tank, with several huge, thick wheels and a pointed front end.  The windshield was tinted a dark black; Connor couldn't see who was driving this thing.

He started to turn around and run away, thinking it was another army craft, but he heard someone scream, "Connor, wait!"

He spun back towards the unusual truck, and saw a gulf-wing style door open on the driver's side.  Out leaned a girl, who couldn't be more than sixteen.  She had bright red hair, pale skin, a skinny build, looked to be about five foot ten, and was wearing a camouflage tube top and a pair of khaki shorts.

"Who are you?  How do you know my name?"  Connor asked in amazement.

"My name is Jade.  Hurry, get in the back.  We don't have much time!"

She flicked a switch on the dashboard, and the back of the vehicle opened apart, revealing a large space, big enough for Connor to ride in.

He knew he had to do something, but he hesitated to trust this mysterious stranger.  "Why should I go with you?" He asked.

"Because we can help you.  Look, you're all confused with what's been happening, but believe me, I know what you're going through."

She smiled gently at him, but her smile quickly turned to a look of desperation.  She pointed behind him.  "Hurry, they're almost here!"

Connor turned around; the military was almost upon them.  He didn't have much choice, so he ran to the back of the truck and climbed in.  As quickly as he got in, the truck began to move, turning to flee their assailants.

In the front of the vehicle, Jade flicked the switch to close the back, and shifted gears.  She looked in the mirror and saw that the army trucks were right on their tail now.  Several soldiers began opening fire on them.

"Christ!" she screamed.  She turned to her companion in the passenger's seat: a 14-year-old Hispanic boy who was seven feet tall with black shoulder-length hair.  "Miguel," she exclaimed.  "Return their fire!"  She grabbed the semi-automatic rifle behind her seat and tossed it at him.

"J-jade," he stammered, "I-I haven't used one of these since training!"

"Well, now's the perfect time to start," she said.  "We're not going to lose them easily!"

Shaking, Miguel turned off the safety, then opened the passenger side door.  Leaning out meekly, he blindly pointed the gun and fired a few rounds, which bounced off the side of their own vehicle.

"Jesus, Miguel," Jade said.  "Look, you take the wheel, I'll take the gun.

She jumped out of her seat and over to the passenger side, grabbing the gun from Miguel's hands.  He quickly grabbed the wheel, and swerved just in time to avoid running into a creek.

Jade stuck her foot around a handle on the side of the truck, and leaned out as far as she could.  Bringing the gun to her eyes, she lined up her target.

RAT-A-TAT-TAT-TAT

Her bullets struck the tires of the closest Hummer, causing them to start to lose air.  She quickly hit the tires of all the vehicles chasing them as much as she could, ducking back into the truck whenever she was being fired at.  The Hummers all soon began to slow down, and their vehicle began speeding away.

Jade sat back down inside and closed the door.  "I think we can outrun them now," she said.  She looked over at Miguel, who was too focused on his driving to pay any attention.  Jade laughed.  She couldn't blame him; the Chimera was a tough truck to drive, and required all your concentration.

Jade sat down the gun behind her seat, and opened the door that connected the cargo area to the cab, closing it behind her.

Connor had his back to her, but she could tell that he was frightened.  He filled up most of the cargo area; sitting on the floor, he had to almost lie down to not bump his head on the ceiling.

Jade placed his hand on his arm.  "Connor?"

"What?"

"Look, I know there's a lot going on right now, but trust me, when we get back to our base, we'll answer as many of your questions as we can."

He turned over to face Jade, and she finally got her first look at him up close.  She knew he was an attractive boy, but she had never gotten to look at his eyes, which were deep, and brooding.  Even though he was three years younger than her, he had already begun to develop a muscular build, which was only enhanced by his new height.  Maybe, in another life...

"Well," Connor said, "can you at least answer one question for me right now?"

Jade nodded.  "I'll try."

"How did you know who I was, and where to find me?"

Jade smiled.  "Because I'm your guardian, Connor."

Connor's nose scrunched up in confusion.  "Guardian?"

"Well, it'll make a lot more sense when you find out what our group is," Jade said, brushing the hair out of her eyes, "but for the past three years, I've been assigned to watch you, make sure nothing was to happen to you, and to be ready for what happened today."

"Wait," Connor said, "you were watching me?"

"Well, more like just general monitoring," Jade shrugged.  "You're a very special person, Connor.  All of us in the League are."

Connor leaned back, trying to make sense of this all. The League? What the hell was that?

"Don't worry, Connor," Jade said, comforting him, "this will all be a lot better, real soon."

As they continued down the road, Connor stayed silent, and Jade moved back towards the front of the vehicle for the rest of the trip.
111111.title: The Chase

choices: Go meet with the council
Take a look around first
1111111.content:
The back doors to the truck opened up. The ride had been over an hour, and Connor's eyes were used to the dark, so when the light poured in, he had to shield his eyes for a few seconds until they adjusted.

When he could see again, he saw Jade standing on the ground right outside the truck, smiling. He leaned forward, looking up at the giant cavern they were in. It was at least half a mile wide and the ceiling was at least two hundred feet off the ground. Balconies ran along the side, like the levels of a giant shopping mall. A giant shopping mall designed by moles.

Though there was definitely a lot of natural forces that created this huge cavern, Connor noticed a lot of man-made improvements: doors on the side of the wall leading to other sections of the base, moving walkways, escalators and elevators, TV monitors and computer banks all over the place. There were also two other large vehicles parked on the other side of the cavern, similar to the one he was currently in.

Connor was impressed at what he saw. It reminded him of some of the comic books he read when he was a little younger.

He looked back at Jade, who was now talking to Miguel, coaching him on his rifle skills. Connor stared at Miguel for a minute, astonished. Yes, his seven-foot height wasn't near what Connor's was, but it was still a sight Connor was unaccustomed to.

"Wow," Connor said, pointing to Miguel, "does he have what I have?"

Miguel smirked, blushing a little, as he walked away towards a door marked "Vehicle Maintenance". Jade was trying to hide her amusement, but couldn't keep it in; she threw her head back and laughed loudly.

"What's so funny?" Connor asked as he got out of the truck. Just then, he heard a loud snicker from behind him. He turned around and saw a giant pair of legs at his eye level. He looked up, and up, and up, astonished to see a sixty-foot tall fifteen year old girl standing next to a door about the same height, which they had just taken the truck through. She was wearing what looked like something out of Star Trek: a collared shirt made of red and black fabric with a cool looking silver stripe crossing from her right shoulder to her left hip; long, tapered black pants with a red stripe down the sides, and shiny black boots covering her feet, nearly the size of a car. Connor could make out a patch on the right side of her shirt, with a big L in the middle and a G and a T on either side, all in very sleek, futuristic font.

"L-G-T?" Connor asked, pointing to the patch.  "What's that?"

"It's the League of Giant Teens," Tara replied.  "That's who we are."

Connor spent so much time examining the stunning outfit, that he barely noticed the girl who was wearing it. "Welcome back, Jade," the girl said, waving.

"Thanks, Tara," Jade replied. "I gotta tell ya, this was one hell of a mission."

"This must be Connor, then," Tara said, as she kneeled down to get a closer look. Connor stared in amazement at Tara's face looming above his. She was a light-skinned black girl, with chocolate-brown wavy hair that came down to her neck. She had a thick, muscular build; Connor imagined that at the height of an average girl her age, she would have been a star athlete. At her waist was some sort of firearm that Connor didn't recognize; it looked like it was big enough to take out a tank with one shot, but in relation to Tara it wasn't any larger than a handgun, and was shaped similarly.

Tara stuck her hand out, causing Connor to instinctively back away at first. "Nice to finally meet you, Connor," she said. After a few seconds, Connor shook her hand, which was more than twice the size of his.

"Tara is part of our security team here," Jade said. "She graduated top of her training class."

You act like that's such a big deal, Jade," Tara said, rolling her eyes, then standing back up to her full height. "There were less than twenty of us."

"Regardless," Jade said to Connor, "she's one of the most talented members of the league. That's why she's on security. "Come on, Connor," she said as she started walking away, "follow me. We have to meet the council shortly."

"The council?" Connor asked.  "What's that?"

"Don't worry," she said, "they're just three older members of the league who set the plan for what we all do. They're actually pretty cool, and they really want to meet you, which is surprising for a newbie. But first, we need to get you some clothes."

Connor suddenly realized that he had been half-naked all this time. He looked down and saw that the red bed sheet was still draped around his waist, but was barely covering anything. In the excitement of the escape, he hadn't even thought about it. What the hell, he figured. He had a damn fine body, and he was proud to show it off.

He started following Jade, who had hopped on a bike and was peddling fast, so that she wouldn't be outpaced by Connor's much longer legs. As they walked across the cavern, Connor noticed lots of different teenagers throughout the cavern, of all different sizes. None were as big as Tara, but a few were the same height as Connor. Others were fifteen feet tall, ten feet tall, or even Jade's height or smaller. Some wore different versions of the space-age suit Tara was wearing, others wore button up shirts and slacks, t-shirts and shorts, skirts, jeans, and the like. A few boys were even walking around shirtless, with an outfit similar to Connor's. All looked to be between the ages of 14 and 18.

Jade led Connor towards the opposite end, where she stopped at a counter that had a computer with a large LCD monitor attached to it. Behind the counter was a long pole that ran back behind the wall to another room. She clicked the mouse and started up a program.

"Let's see, what kind of clothes would you like right now?" she asked.

Connor pointed back towards where Tara was standing. "Can I have an outfit like that?"
Jade chuckled, a laugh that was beginning to grow on Connor. "Those are team outfits; they're specially made when you're assigned your squad upon graduation from training."

Connor sighed. "Oh, well. Then what are my choices?"

"Well, let me enter your current size in to the computer," she said as she typed. "What are you, about thirty feet tall?"

"Uh, I dunno," Connor said, "I didn't really have the chance to measure."

"Don't worry," Jade replied, "we just have to get a general fit for right now. Male, three-zero feet, slender build... Hmm, looks like we don't currently have much in your size."

She pulled up a few outfits on the monitor: one was a simple red shirt with blue jeans, a color combination that Connor didn't much care for; there was a couple of fancy suits, but Connor didn't feel like dressing up if he didn't have to. He finally settled on a navy blue polo shirt with khaki shorts. Jade added on some boxers and an undershirt to the package and clicked "Accept."

The wall behind them began to whir loudly, and soon, a large garment bag zipped down the pole towards them.  Connor picked it up and opened it; inside was the exact outfit Connor had selected.

"Go ahead," Jade said, "try it on."  She pointed to a large divider that offered connor some privacy.  He went behind it and changed in to the clothes.  Surprisingly, they were just a bit baggy, but they would work.

He stepped back from behind the divider.  "Well," he asked Jade, "what do you think?"
"Perfect!" she said, smiling.  "You'll just have to grow into them."

11111111.content:
"Let's go meet with the council," Connor said. Â "It'll be nice to finally get some answers."

"Alrighty, then," Jade answered. Â She pulled out what looked like a cell phone and pressed a button. Â "This is Jade. Â Tell the council that we're on our way."

"10-4," replied a voice from the radio.

Jade motioned for Connor to follow her, and she hopped back on the bike, heading towards the east end of the cavern, where a metal door covered the wall. Â As they approached the door, she pointed the phone-device at the door and pressed a few buttons. Â The device beeped affirmatively, and the giant doors slowly began to slide open. Â After they had opened enough for them to enter, she pedaled on through, with Connor following behind.

This new room was even more impressive than the main cavern. Â It too had a high ceiling, but was only about five hundred feet deep and two hundred feet wide. Â Rows of various-sized chairs lined the walls to the right and left, and at the front of the room was a long desk thirty feet high which had a large seal in the middle with the letters "LGT" emblazoned in bright gold.

"Welcome, Connor," said a voice from behind the desk, "It's nice to finally meet you."

As Connor was examining the desk and the surroundings, he had missed those who were sitting behind the desk.

"Allow me to introduce the council," said the voice, which belonged to the largest person Connor had seen yet. Â It was a one hundred foot tall boy who looked to be seventeen. Â He had olive skin, deep brown eyes, and short-cut jet-black hair; Connor guessed he was of Middle Eastern descent. Â He was wearing a long sleeveless white robe that stretched from his shoulders to his bare feet. Â The robe hung open, revealing his defined pecs, abs, and arm muscles, as well as a pair of tan pants that cut off halfway between his knees and ankles. Â To Connor, the boy looked like he could be a genie from Arabian Nights.

"My name is Khenti," the boy said, "but everyone calls me Khen. Â I am the current Council Leader, and am the oldest remaining among the League."

Connor realized he was staring with his mouth hanging open. Â He regained his composure, and gave a half bow, unsure of how to respond. Â "Hello, Khenti--er, Khen."

Khen smiled and chuckled. Â "No need to bow, Connor. Â We treat everyone as equals here."

Connor nodded, and stood straight up.

"It's alright Connor," said a female voice to Khen's left. Â "We know how you're feeling; we've all been there." Â The voice, which had a proper British accent, belonged to a girl who was about half as tall as Khen, but still a good twenty feet taller than Connor. Â She had short blonde hair and a determined look to her face. Â She was dressed in an outfit similar to Tara's, the security guard Connor had seen in the main cavern, and she looked to be a year or two younger than Khen.

"My name is Penny," the girl said. Â "I am the head of security for the League. Â And I play a mean game of football, if I do say so myself. Â Oh, I'm sorry--you Yanks call it 'soccer'. Â In any case, we'll have to play sometime."

A grin crossed Connor's face. Â He didn't think he'd do so hot against a girl who had a good twenty feet height advantage on him. "Hello, Penny," was all he said.

"And that brings us to me!" said a voice Ken's right. Â Connor had to squint to make out who was talking; he finally saw a boy standing on the desk. Â The boy was only six feet tall ("Only six feet", Connor thought to himself, "that's something I never thought I'd say."), looked to be about fourteen, and was wearing a white lab coat. Â He looked to be half-Asian, with long, styled black hair and a pair of horn-rimmed glasses.

"Call me Chris," he said, with a wide smile. Â "I'm the new head of research and technology for the League; just got elected last month. Â I know, it may seem like I'm playing to that whole 'Asian nerd stereotype' thing, but, believe me, there's more here than meets the eye."

Though Connor couldn't help but think "Geek" when he looked at him, there was something about the boy that exuded an air of coolness and mystery to him. Â "Hello, Chris," he said.

"And that brings us to you, Connor," Khen said. Â “Of course, nothing really needs to be said there; we know pretty much all about you.”

This took Connor by surprise, and he furrowed his brow quizzingly. Â Â “Really?” He asked. Â “What exactly do you know?"

Chris responded, “Well, today’s your thirteenth birthday--Happy Birthday, by the way; you’re the oldest of two children; you’ve lived at the same house all your life; you like video games, comics, and bicycling; you’ve made mostly As throughout school with a few Bs and one C in Mrs. Lowery’s Spanish class in sixth grade--”

Khen stuck out his hand. Â “Enough, Chris. Â I think he gets the idea.”

Connor was speechless. Â “How do you know all this stuff about me?”

“Well,” Penny said, “we’ve been kinda spying on you. Â For a few years now.”

“Spying?!” Connor exclaimed. Â “What the hell?!”

Khen leaned forward towards Connor. Â “Trust us, Connor, when we say that it was only for your own good. Â You’re very special, Connor, and we want to help you achieve your potential.”

Connor shook his head. Â He couldn’t believe all that he was hearing. Â He had been spied on by these guys? Â He was special? Â What were they talking about? Â He didn’t know if he could take any more. Â Maybe trusting these guys was a mistake. Â But what could he do?

111111111.content:
Connor took a deep breath, trying to calm himself down, but he still felt betrayed, his fists starting to clench up. Â He knew he had to give them a chance to explain everything, but part of him felt like he didn’t want to hear what they had to say. Â “Okay guys,” Connor said through clenched teeth, his frustration now becoming visible, “I demand answers. Â Now!”Â 

This last word had been shouted with some force, and the three members of the council were taken aback, exchanging concerned glances with each other. Â Khen started to say something, but Jade stepped forward in front of Connor and interrupted them. Â “I’m sorry, guys; Connor has had a really rough day."

Penny nodded, but a stern expression remained on her face. "Of course, Jade; we've gotten the summary Miguel filed." She turned and looked at Khen, whispering something into his ear. Khen closed his eyes, took a deep breath, and nodded.

Turning back to Connor, Penny folded her hands on the desk, leaning forward slightly. "All right, Connor, you got it. We're here to help you, not to make things worse than they already are. So for the next ten minutes, we'll answer any questions you may have."

Surprised a little, Conner relaxed his fists and took a few breaths, trying to control his emotions. "Thank you," he said, making sure to sound sincere. He closed his eyes and put his thoughts in order. There were so many questions swirling around in his head that he wasn't sure of which one to ask first. But he supposed he should start at the beginning.Â 

"So," he started, making sure he chose his words carefully, "I keep hearing about 'The League'. 'The League' this, 'The League' that. Frankly, I just want to know what the hell 'The League' actually is!"

Khen shrugged slightly. "That's a fair enough question, I suppose. You'll learn about it in great detail in your Orientation class tomorrow, but here's the basics.Â 

"On the surface, we're just what our name says: an organization for teenagers who have the special ability to control their own growth. But in reality, there's a lot more to us than that."

Penny continue the explanation. "We fight alongside various underground groups around the world in resistance against the Chordata. In a way, we're all that stands between them and total planetary domination."

"Wait, wait, wait," Connor said, confused. "The Chordata?"

Chris sighed, taking off his glasses and rubbing his eyes. "Guys, this is gonna be all too much for him to take on at once. Can't it wait for tomorrow?"

Khen turned to Chris and shook his head. "No, we made a promise, and he wants to know; I don't blame him." Â He faced forward again. "Connor, the Chordata are the bad guys. They've been around for centuries, and have manipulated world leaders and events to work towards their ultimate goal: total control of the planet, and the destruction of all who stand in their way."

This was beginning to sound crazy to Connor, but then again, so had everything else that happened so far today. Sensing his confusion, Jade moved closer to him and placed a hand on his shoulder. "Remember the military vehicles that attacked us earlier?" Connor nodded. "They were under orders to take you to a Chordata holding facility, one that masquerades as a US Army base."

"Wait," Connor thought for a moment, "you're not talking about the base my parents were taking me to, are you?"

Jade closed her eyes, nodding somberly. "Yes, Connor. West Taylor is actually managed by Chordata forces. They have control over much of the American military."

"But, did my parents--"

"I think that's all he needs to know right now," Chris interrupted, nearly shouting. The expression on his face looked much more serious than it had before.

Feeling the anger start to build again, Connor stepped forward. "No. You promised me you would answer all of my questions. I need to know: did my parents know what they were doing when they took me to the base? Were they-- Are they possibly working with these Chordata people?"

The three on the council looked at each other, all of them reluctant to answer. Khen stood up, walked around to the front of the desk, and leaned back against it. This close, he seemed to be even more of an imposing presence than behind the desk.Â 

"Connor, this is never easy to say," he started, then paused. Finally, he just came out with it. "Your parents ARE Chordata. All of our parents are. That's how we became the way we are."

This answer stunned Connor slightly, and he started to feel a little light-headed. Seeing this, Jade brought over a stool, which, while nearly twice as big as her, was barely enough to hold Connor's much bigger stature when he sat down on it. He began to hyperventilate a little. If what the Council said happened to be true... Connor couldn't begin to imagine what that would mean for him and his family.

As he became more and more overwhelmed with what had just been made known, he felt his emotions beginning to boil again. Bewilderment, frustration, and fear all swirled in his head, but a new feeling was bubbling underneath: anger. Anger at his parents, anger at the world and the-- the Chordata, whoever the hell they were. Right now, though, the only ones he could focus it on, the only ones he could see ... were the council.Â 

As his rage began to manifest, he felt his muscles begin to tense and his skin tingle, a sensation he had felt before and recognized the significance of. He looked up at the Council, his eyes starting to water slightly as he felt his clothing start to get tighter once more.

111112.content:
Originally by: inuyasha (79)

Connor knew there had to be an explanation to why his parents were going to bring him to an army base and he knew he wouldn't get that answer if they died. Plus, they were his family. No matter how much they pissed him off, he still loved them and didn't want to hurt them.

Running toward the car, Connor ripped the roof off of the car and carefully picked his parents up. A minute after he had ran away, he heard a loud explosion from where the car was. Connor found himself in a forest. Since the trees were taller than him, he figured it would be a great place to hide until he could get an answer out of his parents.

He sat down and right away, felt his dad stir in his hand. As his father's eyes opened, the man quickly got up.

"Connor, where are we? What happened to the car? Why did you-"

Connor cut him off, "It's okay dad, everything's fine. The car didn't make it, but I saved you guys just in time,"

"Yeah, saved us from something you caused? Why would you do something like that when you knew the risks?" his father asked.

"I'm sorry dad, I was so angry at the time, I just....let it take over. I mean, you didn't tell me anything about why we were going to the Army, yet you expected me to understand everything". His dad sighed.

"I'm sorry too Connor. It's just, your mom and I...well, let me start from the beginning. When you were born, the doctors discovered that there was something in your DNA that didn't match up. Don't worry, you are human, but there was an extra gene that they couldn't figure out. There were two cases before you like this and one after you, but after that, the doctors found no traces of that extra gene, even to this day. Well, a couple of years ago, one of the kids that had the extra gene, David, started growing, like you are now, on his thirteenth birthday. After that, we knew that must have been what would happen to you. We were contacted by the army, who said they wanted to set up a special program with the four of you that had the extra gene, but we don't know what the program is. But I can assure you it is not something with experiments or tests".

Connor looked down at his dad with mixed emotions. He was somewhat upset that his parents didn't tell him earlier, but he was also relieved he knew everything. He had a better relationship with his dad than his mom. He didn't hate his mom, but his dad and he got along better. They would always go out to sports games or movies, even out for ice cream, just to talk.

"Why did you keep this from me dad? I mean, you and I are so close, why didn't you tell me?" Connor asked. He wasn't crying, but his voice carried sadness.

"I'm sorry son, we just thought you would want to live a normal life with no worries about this. I know it was somewhat wrong not to tell you, but would you have wanted to go through your life knowing about this, dreading this day for the fact that you wouldn't be normal anymore?"

Connor knew his dad was right. He would have dreaded this day if he knew it was coming and looking back, he knew he wouldn't want to change the life he had.

"Thanks dad," he said. His dad nodded and (as best as he could) hugged Connor around his neck.

1111121.content:
Originally by: inuyasha (79)

Connor, with his parents in hand, had started walking toward the army base. His mom was still unconsious, but he was fine with getting the directions from his dad. Suprisingly, they reached the army base in a shorter amount of time than his dad thought, though that was probably due to his son's longer legs.

There was nothing around the base. No roads, no planes, no sign of life. They were in front of a solid green wall bigger than Connor, about fifty feet tall. Connor's dad motioned for his son to put him down. When he reached the ground, he walked over to a black box and pressed a button.

"Hello, this Rick Jackson. You all are expecting my son Connor today". That was all he had to say before a portion of the wall in front of them opened up like a door. The opening was big enough for Connor, who picked his dad up and headed inside.

The first thing Connor noticed was the gigantic (he guessed maybe 200 feet) tall building in front of him. He saw a couple of jeeps around the building but no one walking around. But he soon saw someone exit the building and walk up to Connor's feet. The giant boy bent down, so the man wouldn't hurt his neck looking up at him.

"Hello Connor and Rick. My name is General Harris and I run this facility. Do you need anything first? Food, a bed?"

Connor spoke up, "Uh, actually my mom....fell asleep," he said, not wanting to mention the incident earlier. He held out his hand containing his unconsious mom, "Can you get someone to put her in a bed?"

General Harris nodded. He called for someone over his walkie and waited. Seconds later, a man came out with a stretcher, took Connor's mom out of his hand and headed back inside.

"Now let's go on a tour first, shall we?" General Harris turned around and started walking around the building.

"This army base was built just for you Connor. Well, for you and the other three like you. It's big enough to hold you and you won't have to worry about anyone seeing you, since no one ever comes around here".

Connor was interested in the tour, he really was, but he was finding it boring. He had to take one step every thirty seconds just so he wouldn't have to pass the General.

"Ummm..excuse me sir," Connor interrupted, "But is there a way we could do this faster? No disrespect, but it's kind of boring walking this slow,".General Harris laughed.

"I guess you're right. Well, we'll have the others give you the tour later than. For now," General Harris pointed at a large door, "you can go in there and meet them. If you don't mind, can you leave your dad here so we can talk?"

Connor nodded and lowered his hand carrying his dad down to the ground. Rick got out, told Connor to "have fun" and walked away with the General. As Connor started heading for the door, he wondered about who he was going to meet inside.

As he pushed the door open, he saw that he appeared to be in a room that resembled a regular bedroom. There were two bunkbeds, one on the left side and one on the right. In the back of the room were two doors, one behind each bunk bed.

Before he could explore the room, he saw two people enter the room. Both were boys and were the same height Connor was. One had short blond hair, and blue eyes, the other had shaggy brown hair and brown eyes.

The blond haired one spoke up first, "Hey man. Are you the new kid? I'm David," he said, extending his hand out. Connor took it and just as he was done shaking, the brown haired kid extended his hand, "I'm Tim". Connor shook his hand and started to open his mouth to talk, but David beat him to it.

"You probably have alot of questions right now, so sit down and we'll talk". David and Tim sat on the bottom bunk of the left bed and Connor sat opposite them.

"So what's question number one?" Tim smiled.

Connor quickly asked, "What am I doing here?"

David answered this question. "You met General Harris right?" Connor nodded. "That's my dad. See, when this happened to me and since I was the first one this happened to, he had an idea. He quickly made a plan that secretly went through the government and had this army base built. We're sort of superheroes you could say. Whenever something happens around here that could be more than the police ot firefighters can handle, they send us out to help them out. It's not bad actually. Plus, while we're here, we get to learn more about our powers and control them, learning new abilities".

Connor quickly tried to soak everything in. But after that long explaination, Connor had another question for David.

"So the general is your dad?"

"Yeah, but he's cool. Dad can be a bit tough to deal with at times, but he only wants the best for us".

"So who is the other kid?" Connor asked.

"Well," Tim started, "As you know, we were born before you were. David is 16 and I'm 14. The other kid, Kevin, isn't 13 yet, but he will be soon. I beleive his birthday is in six or seven months".

Connor nodded and asked his final question, "So what abilities have you guys learned that you can teach me?"

David answered this one. "Well the biggest thing we've learned so far is how to control our size. We can, but rarely, shrink back to our normal size and can grow bigger than our size now. There are some other powers, but we'll help you learn them along the way".

Connor thanked them and they spent the next hour getting to know each other and soon became fast friends.

"Conner, what are we supposed to be looking at, besides you not being dressed?"

He felt his mouth open agape slightly. How did they not notice? "I can't get dressed, Mom, because none of my clothes fit! And none of my clothes fit because I'm over seven feet tall!"

"We know how tall you are, son, and it's about time you realized that you're due for a refresher in wardrobe. Those clothes you've been wearing have been too small for ages, now, and we're finally going to get something that fits you properly!"

"What? Who cares about my clothes?!"

"You do, apparently, or else you wouldn't keep wearing them and bringing them up at breakfast," Conner's dad chuckled.

What on earth were they talking about? Conner wondered. "Helloooooo? Am I the only one who sees that I've-"

He was cut off as the familiar pains and burning sensations kicked in. "Hold on," Conner said, in half a daze, and closed his eyes. He waited until the feelings had receded, then opened them again- his vision definitely higher than what it was several minutes ago. "A-HA!" He said with satisfaction. There's no way this wouldn't resolve it.

"A-ha, what?"

"Just now!"

"Just what, dear?"

"Just now! I JUST grew several inches! How could you not notice?!" Conner let out, slightly panicked. Conner's mom just blinked and stared at him with furrowed eyebrows to mark her confusion.

"Conner... your height hasn't changed since you hit 8'5" several months ago. You're done growing." Conner was about to speak out at this absurdity when his dad interrupted him.

"I've had enough of this nonsense, I've got work. Conner, get a pair of sweats from my room upstairs. You can wear them to mow the lawn, and when you're done, your mother and you are going clothes-shopping. No more excuses- eat your cereal."

"But-"

"I said EAT." His stern look told Conner that this was the end of all possible discussion. Conner frowned, collapsed on a chair he barely fit on, and ate his cereal in silence.

The rest of the morning was executed in eerie silence. Conner looked down at his parents several feet below him. What was going on that he wasn't being seen as any bigger? What was happening to them? What was happening to him? His mind swirled with questions as he rinsed his bowl out, put it in the washing machine, and lumbered into the garage to get the mower.

----

It was summer vacation, which on the plus side meant no school,
and on the minus side meant crazy temperatures. Conner panted as he worked on the yard, his enlarged body covered in sweat. Forced to work without a shirt and in sweatpants in a ninety-degree heat should be criminal, he thought miserably to himself. He wondered how many of his classmates were actually enjoying their time off, instead of being forced into unpaid labor. He surveyed his work, as he finished pushing the mover down another row. About half-done with the front yard. Actually making good time, he thought- at least the height did that much for him. Didn't make it any less weird, though. Not even the passersby on the streets looked at him twice before they continued their jogs and dog-walks. He was about to resume when he saw the garage door open and his parents' car slide out. "Going to pick up some groceries, be back soon," He heard his mom call out before it turned onto the street and sped away. He let out a sigh of relief that he was now alone, and trotted back inside to cool off for a bit.

As he rested on the first couch he encountered, he thought carefully about his parents' reactions- or lack thereof. What on earth could it mean? What was wrong with them (or him, he reasoned) that they couldn't remember anything about what happened directly in front of them? He couldn't elaborate on this much, because the chime of a doorbell interrupted his thoughts shortly after. He huffed at the irritation. Perfect timing. He approached the door and opened it, hoping whatever it was could be brief.

The person at the door was a young East Asian girl, probably fourteen years old from the looks of her. She was wearing a knee-length robin's egg blue skirt, with a white top to complement it, clearly casual wear. Her long black hair reached down her back almost to her waist. At a second's glance from her to you, she instantly broke into an excited smile.

"PERFECT! You must be Conner!" She burst energetically.

Conner was taken aback. "How did you know my name...?" He slowly asked, with a hint of suspicion.

"Well, because you're eight friggin' feet tall and thirteen years old, duh," she said jokingly, like it was the most obvious thing in the world. Conner didn't have time to rally this information within him before she sped off again. "Look, I understand that you're really confused, maybe even a little scared, and that's natural, but I don't really have the time to explain everything here, and it's seriously important that I get to back to base, pronto," she rattled on breathlessly. "Once we're there, I promise to tell you everything you want to ask, but in the meantime, you've gotta trust me on this."

A lot to ask from a teenage giant you just met, Conner thought. "What about my parents? Are they going to worry about me?"

"Your parents will be fine! The Transification Field we've got going right now is completely temporary, but without it, things get messy, and if you stay here, things are going to get even messier. So if you don't mind..."

"The WHAT? What did you do to my parents?!" Conner's voice raised significantly.

The girl groaned and rolled her eyes. "It's not important, I swear! I'll tell you everything, but you've got to trust me and come-right-now!" She tugged on Conner's arm twice at the end for emphasis, though he didn't budge an inch.

"Why the hell would I do that, I don't even know your name!" he shouted.

"Katie," She responded curtly. "Now come on!"

info.brief_description: Having just turned 13, Connor becomes a giant, and joins a group of other giant teens.
info.description:
Connor wakes up on his thirteenth birthday, ready to face what he thinks will be just another day. He is wrong. He starts to grow substantially bigger, causing him and his family to start freaking out. This leads him to finding out and joining up with a group of other giant teens. They help Connor control his power(s), and help him become a member of the League of Giant Teens.

Unlike most of my other stories on this site, this story will focus on a single main protagonist (Connor). Other characters can be brought on for support, and our narrative can shift to these characters as needed, but the story should never be too far away from Connor. I want this to focus more on plot and character development than some of my other stories. Also, as a 13+ story, explicit sexuality will not be allowed. That isn't to say there shouldn't be romantic involvement or intimacy, but don't take it too far. Basically, if it wouldn't be in a PG-13 rated movie, don't put it in here.

Also, though all story ideas and plot twists are appreciated, there is one storyline I would like to reserve for myself. It's the story path with all ones (1-1-1-1, etc.). As such, one choice at the end of this line will always be marked "RESERVED". While you are more than welcome to branch off from any of these chapters by using their 2nd choices (or more, if present), any chapter added to the choice marked "RESERVED" will be deleted or moved around, depending on how well I can accommodate it. There will only be one chapter at a time in this story that will be reserved at any given time. I apologize for this one conceit to myself, and hope you understand.

Overall, though, I hope you enjoy the story, and have fun!!

Check out my portfolio citywalker (47) for my other sci-fi and fantasy stories featuring transformation, muscle development, and growth! And email me if you have any questions or just want to talk.
